# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here's the solution:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]+" => "_")
end

println(clean_column("My Column"))
```
When you run this code, it will print "my_column". The function `clean_column` takes a string `col`, converts it to lower case and strips leading/trailing spaces using `lowercase` and `strip`. Then it replaces any sequence of one or more spaces or hyphens with an underscore.

The `replace` method is used with a regular expression (regex) that matches one or more space characters (`r"[ -]+"`), replacing them with an underscore (`_`). The result is printed out using `println`.
